intro: Alseodaphne excelsa, commonly known as the giant alseodaphne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is a tall evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 40 meters, making it one of the tallest trees in its native habitat. The tree has smooth, greyish-brown bark and elliptical, glossy green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It produces small, fragrant flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. This species is found in the rainforests of Southeast Asia and is valued for its hard, durable wood.
